English: God, who at various times and in various ways spoke in time past to the fathers by the prophets
Bahnar: Chăl arih lu yă 'bok bơ̆n sơ̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh lu 'bok khan lê̆ hơdrol năm pơtruh kơ lu yă 'bok bơ̆n gah tơdrong Sư lơ 'măng phara pha.

English: has in these last days spoken to us by His Son, whom He has appointed heir of all things, through whom also He made the worlds
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah chăl arih lu bơ̆n ahrei, Sư wơh Kon Sư kơdih năm pơtruh kơ bơ̆n. Sư kư̆m ăn kơ Kon Sư gơh pơjing plĕnh pơjing teh păng pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong.

English: who being the brightness of His glory and the express image of His person, and upholding all things by the word of His power, when He had by Himself purged our sins, sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high
Bahnar: 'Bă Sư thoi lĕ kơ măt 'năr, Kon Sư thoi lĕ kơ hơdah. Tơdrong hơbŏ Sư kư̆m thoi lĕ kơ 'Bă Sư, Sư pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng kơ plĕnh păng teh, yua kơ Sư Yang, Sư mơsêh tơpă. Păng Sư đei jur tơ teh âu ăn akâu Sư kơdih dŏng pơklaih kon bơngai đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Đang tơdrong 'noh boih na Sư tŏk oei gah 'ma kơ 'Bă Sư pơgơ̆r tơ kơpal plĕnh ti.

English: having become so much better than the angels, as He has by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.
Bahnar: 'Bă Sư ăn kơ Sư tih hloh kơ lu linh jang, thoi noh mă 'Bă Sư krao kơ Sư Kon. Sư tih hloh kơ lu linh jang tơpă.

English: For to which of the angels did He ever say: “You are My Son, Today I have begotten You”? And again: “I will be to Him a Father, And He shall be to Me a Son”?
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh tam layơ khan kơ linh jang, dang Sư khan kơ Kon Sư sơ̆ khan: “Ih boih Kon Inh, năr âu Inh wă ăn kơ Ih pơgơ̆r.” Sư kư̆m khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Inh pơm 'Bă Ih, Ih pơm Kon Inh.”

English: But when He again brings the firstborn into the world, He says: “Let all the angels of God worship Him.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na kơplah năr mă Sư ăn Kon Sư kơdih jur tơ teh âu sơ̆, Sư krao đĭ-đăng kơ lu linh jang Sư khan: “Ơ đĭ-đăng lu linh jang Inh, kơkuh kơ Sư bĕ.”

English: And of the angels He says: “Who makes His angels spirits And His ministers a flame of fire.”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan dơ̆ng gah lu linh jang Sư khan: “Inh ăn kơ lu linh jang mă pơm đam Inh, jang hơbĕch dang kial hơbal dang pla ŭnh.”

English: But to the Son He says: “Your throne, O God, is forever and ever; A scepter of righteousness is the scepter of Your kingdom.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah Kon Sư kơdih khan thoi âu: “Ih Kră Yang tơoei kơpal tang-dŏ pơgơ̆r ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch; Ih pơgơ̆r 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: You have loved righteousness and hated lawlessness; Therefore God, Your God, has anointed You With the oil of gladness more than Your companions.”
Bahnar: Ih lăp đon kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng areh kơ tơdrong kơnê̆. Yua kơ thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Ih, pôk Ih oei tơ tang-dŏ păng pik kơ Ih đak pơgang 'bâu phu, ăn kơ Ih hiôk hloh, tih hloh kơ lu bôl buăl Ih.”

English: And: “You, LORD, in the beginning laid the foundation of the earth, And the heavens are the work of Your hands.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan dơ̆ng kơ Sư thoi âu: “Ơ Kră Yang, blŭng-a sơ̆ Ih pơjing plĕnh pơjing teh, Ih pơjing kơdih ưh kơ đei bu nai pơjing.

English: They will perish, but You remain; And they will all grow old like a garment
Bahnar: Mă plĕnh teh gô hiong răm, gah Ih oei oei ling-lang. Plĕnh teh đĭ so dŏ so don thoi lĕ kơ hơbĕn ao so.

English: Like a cloak You will fold them up, And they will be changed. But You are the same, And Your years will not fail.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Ih gơh pơih tŭk thoi đe kuă kơ hrŭk hơbĕn ao so boih. Ih tơplih plĕnh teh 'nao kư̆m lei-lăi thoi đe tơplih hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'nao; Mă sơnăm Ih hơnơ̆ng lei-lăi ưh kơ layơ tôch.”

English: But to which of the angels has He ever said: “Sit at My right hand, Till I make Your enemies Your footstool”?
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei tam layơ khan kơ linh jang thoi Sư khan kơ Kon Sư thoi âu: “Ih kư̆ oei gah 'ma kơ Inh pơgơ̆r, Tơ̆p Inh blah rôp lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Ih thuơ tơ kơnơl jơ̆ng Ih.”

English: Are they not all ministering spirits sent forth to minister for those who will inherit salvation?
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ lu linh jang, 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh lu sư jur chă tơgŭm lu kon bơngai mă Sư pơklaih ăn oei hơdai hăm Sư ning-mônh.

English: Therefore we must give the more earnest heed to the things we have heard, lest we drift away.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na dang ei bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng kơtăi boih dôm tơdrong đe bơtho, bơ̆n athei kơchăng 'biơ̆ hli kơ bơ̆n jrok trong nai dơ̆ng.

English: For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just reward
Bahnar: Sơ̆ linh jang tơbăt ăn kơ Môis tơdrong juăt kơjăp dêh, na tôm tơdrong yoch kon bơngai pơm mă tih mă iĕ đei tơdrong phak ngăl. Đe phak kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong yoch sư pơm tih dah iĕ.

English: how shall we escape if we neglect so great a salvation, which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord, and was confirmed to us by those who heard Him
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong Yêsu Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei kăl hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng. Thoi noh, tơ̆ng bu ưh kơ gơnang kơ Yêsu pơklaih sư, bơngai noh gô đei tơdrong phak tơpă. Tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu Krist pơklaih bơ̆n, Sư kơdih tơbăt ăn kơ đe sơ̆ na đe tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n.

English: God also bearing witness both with signs and wonders, with various miracles, and gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to His own will?
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai noh gơh pơm lơ tơdrong mơsêh wă tơbăt kơ bơ̆n tơdrong noh sĭt tơpă. Păng Sư ăn kơ lu bơngai lui, Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng hơgei gơh pơm lơ tơdrong nai dơ̆ng, mă Sư ăn pơm kiơ̆ thoi Sư lăp đon.

English: For He has not put the world to come, of which we speak, in subjection to angels.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah tơdrong pơgơ̆r plĕnh păng teh ning-mônh, Sư ưh kơ ăn kơ lu linh jang pơgơ̆r ôh.

English: But one testified in a certain place, saying: “What is man that You are mindful of him, Or the son of man that You take care of him?
Bahnar: Đe chih roi tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Ơ Kră Yang, kon bơngai nhôn dang yơ na Ih mah tơchĕng dêh; kon bơngai nhôn yua kiơ kơ Ih na Ih mah 'mêm 'măi kơ nhôn?

English: You have made him a little lower than the angels; You have crowned him with glory and honor, And set him over the works of Your hands.
Bahnar: Ih ăn kơ nhôn kơđeh 'biơ̆ kơ lu linh jang, mă-lei ưh kơ mah kơđeh dêh. Ih kư̆m ăn kơ nhôn dang lĕ kơ pơm 'bok pơtao

English: You have put all things in subjection under his feet.” For in that He put all in subjection under him, He left nothing that is not put under him. But now we do not yet see all things put under him.
Bahnar: nhôn gơh pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong.” Tơ̆ng thoi ei tơpă, ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ mă kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh pơgơ̆r. Mă-lei dang ei bơ̆n ưh tam 'bôh kon bơngai pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong.

English: But we see Jesus, who was made a little lower than the angels, for the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that He, by the grace of God, might taste death for everyone.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh pôm Yêsu đĕch kơplah Sư oei tơ teh âu sơ̆ Sư dang lĕ kơ iĕ 'biơ̆ kơ lu linh jang, mă-lei lăp minh yuh đĕch. Pôm Sư đĕch bơ̆n 'bôh thoi lĕ kơ kon bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk Sư pơgơ̆r pơm Pơtao, yua kơ Sư chu iŏk tơdrong lôch pơmat tang đĭ rim 'nu bơngai, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm kơ bơ̆n.

English: For it was fitting for Him, for whom are all things and by whom are all things, in bringing many sons to glory, to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing tôm tơdrong. Tôm tơdrong Sư pơjing, noh Sư wă kơ đe ư-ang kơ Sư. Thoi noh na trŏ kơ Sư ăn kơ Yêsu đei tơdrong pơmat-tat, wă kơ Yêsu iŏk tôm tơdrong thoi kon bơngai bơ̆n wă kơ Sư gơh anhăk ba lơ bơngai klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch. Thoi noh na đĭ-đăng lu kon Sư nai kư̆m hiôk lei-lăi thoi Yêsu.

English: For both He who sanctifies and those who are being sanctified are all of one, for which reason He is not ashamed to call them brethren
Bahnar: Yêsu pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch păng pơyơ̆r bơ̆n kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ Sư lăng bơ̆n thoi 'nhŏng oh pôm mĕ 'bă tơpă, 'Bă tơm bơ̆n lăp minh 'nu đĕch, Sư mă oei tơ plĕnh ti. Mă bơngai thoi bơ̆n, Sư kư̆m lăp đon kơ anăn bơ̆n 'nhŏng oh Sư.

English: saying: “I will declare Your name to My brethren; In the midst of the assembly I will sing praise to You.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh kư̆m thoi Sư khan kơ 'Bă Sư sơ̆ thoi âu: “Inh gô pơư pơang anăn Ih kơ lu 'nhŏng oh Inh tơ anăp lu sư mă oei akŭm bôl lơ; păng inh hơri bơnê kơ Ih.”

English: And again: “I will put My trust in Him.” And again: “Here am I and the children whom God has given Me.”
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Inh gơnang kơ Ih tơpă.” Sư kư̆m khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Inh oei hơdai hăm lu kon Inh mă đơ̆ng Ih pơjao.”

English: Inasmuch then as the children have partaken of flesh and blood, He Himself likewise shared in the same, that through death He might destroy him who had the power of death, that is, the devil
Bahnar: Lu kon Sư noh wă khan kon bơngai bơ̆n, na Sư kư̆m jing thoi kon bơngai bơ̆n mơ̆n, wă kơ gơh lôch tang kon bơngai păng pơrăm yŏng pơgơ̆r yang sơmăt mă pơgơ̆r pơlôch kon bơngai.

English: and release those who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.
Bahnar: Sư pơklaih kon bơngai đơ̆ng pơm đĭch yang sơmăt. Sơ̆ kon bơngai đĭch yang sơmăt ling-lang, lu sư hli dêh kơ tơdrong lôch.

English: For indeed He does not give aid to angels, but He does give aid to the seed of Abraham.
Bahnar: Lu linh jang, Yêsu ưh kơ đei tơdŏng ôh, Sư tơdŏng lu bơ̆n mă kon sâu Abraham đĕch.

English: Therefore, in all things He had to be made like His brethren, that He might be a merciful and faithful High Priest in things pertaining to God, to make propitiation for the sins of the people.
Bahnar: Sư pơm tôm tơdrong dang kơ 'nhŏng oh tơpă. Sư jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch kon bơngai thoi 'bok soi tih mơnat kơ kon bơngai, na kon bơngai gơnang kơ Sư tơpă.

English: For in that He Himself has suffered, being tempted, He is able to aid those who are tempted.
Bahnar: Yêsu đei tơdrong pơmat, tơdrong pơhlŭ, na Sư mơnat kơ lu bơ̆n dang ei kơplah mă bơ̆n đei tơdrong pơhlŭ.

English: Therefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Christ Jesus
Bahnar: Ơ lu 'nhŏng oh, iĕm jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt boih păng iĕm đei anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei wă krao tơmơ̆t tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng Sư ning-mônh. Na inh wă kơ iĕm tơchĕng 'biơ̆ gah tơdrong Yêsu mă tơpă, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk Sư pơm jơ̆ng 'bang wă tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Păng 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m pôk Sư pơm 'bok soi tơm jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei gah tơdrong lui bơ̆n.

English: who was faithful to Him who appointed Him, as Moses also was faithful in all His house.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jang 'lơ̆ng tơpă dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ Sư, kư̆m thoi Môis jang tơgŭm hnam dơnŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, sư jang kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă tơpă.

English: For this One has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as He who built the house has more honor than the house.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah Yêsu đe ư-ang hloh kơ Môis, yua kơ Sư tơ'ngla mă pơjing hnam dơnŏ noh. Gah Môis sư minh 'nu bơngai lơ̆m hnam noh đĕch.

English: For every house is built by someone, but He who built all things is God.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ rim hnam đei tơ'ngla pơm ngăl. Tơ'ngla mă pơm noh wă khan 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, yua kơ Sư pơjing tôm tơdrong.

English: And Moses indeed was faithful in all His house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which would be spoken afterward
Bahnar: Môis sư pơm đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei jang tơgŭm kơ đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Sư jang tơnen dêh, sư jang kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă hloi. Sư 'bok khan lê̆ hơdrol bơtho tơbăt kơ kon bơngai gah tơdrong ning-mônh.

English: but Christ as a Son over His own house, whose house we are if we hold fast the confidence and the rejoicing of the hope firm to the end.
Bahnar: Mă Yêsu Krist Sư kư̆m jang trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă mơ̆n, mă Sư jang wei-lăng đĭ-đăng kơ hnam dơnŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei hloi, yua kơ Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu bơ̆n, tơ̆ng bơ̆n oei lui kơjăp, bơ̆n kư̆m hnam dơnŏ Sư mơ̆n, dah bơ̆n oei gơnang kơ Sư tơgŭm bơ̆n khŏm khŏm.

English: Therefore, as the Holy Spirit says: “Today, if you will hear His voice
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp mưh iĕm kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh pơma

English: Do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion, In the day of trial in the wilderness
Bahnar: iĕm 'nĕ pă arăng kơ̆l thoi lu yă 'bok iĕm mă oei tơ dêh glă sơ̆, lu sư kơchu dêh păng pơlong Inh lơ tơdrong tăm.

English: Where your fathers tested Me, tried Me, And saw My works forty years.
Bahnar: Tơ anih âu boih lu yă 'bok iĕm pơlong Inh păng kơchu kơ Inh sơ̆. Lu sư 'bôh ră mơ̆n tơdrong Inh pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu sư kơplah lơ̆m puăn-jĭt sơnăm sơ̆.

English: Therefore I was angry with that generation, And said, ‘They always go astray in their heart, And they have not known My ways.’
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na Inh hil kơ lu sư mah khan thoi âu: ‘Lơ̆m jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm ngăl 'maih chă tơdrong hơwơ̆l kuă kơ chu tơdrong Inh.’

English: So I swore in My wrath, ‘They shall not enter My rest.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh hil kơ lu sư thoi âu: ‘Iĕm pơm thoi noh, iĕm ưh kơ gơh layơ wă mơ̆t pơdơh tơ dêh char Inh.’ ”

English: Beware, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief in departing from the living God
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, iĕm athei kơchăng hli kơ iĕm đei jơhngơ̆m kơnê̆ jing kuă kơ lui, achăng lê̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang.

English: but exhort one another daily, while it is called “Today,” lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.
Bahnar: Kơplah ahrei brei drâu oei tam mơ̆n, na rim năr iĕm athei pơlung dih băl, wă kơ đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm huay kơ lui kơ đe pơhlŭ pơlung iĕm pơm yoch jing arăng kơ̆l.

English: For we have become partakers of Christ if we hold the beginning of our confidence steadfast to the end
Bahnar: Tơdah bơ̆n lui kơjăp khŏm khŏm truh năr tôch, bơ̆n gô oei hơdai hăm Yêsu Krist ling-lang. Tơdah bơ̆n ưh kơ kiơ̆ Sư khŏm khŏm, bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh oei hơdai hăm Sư ôh.

English: while it is said: “Today, if you will hear His voice, Do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp mưh iĕm kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh pơma, iĕm 'nĕ pă arăng kơ̆l thoi lu yă 'bok iĕm mă oei tơ dêh glă sơ̆, lu sư kơchu dêh.”

English: For who, having heard, rebelled? Indeed, was it not all who came out of Egypt, led by Moses?
Bahnar: Kơplah noh sơ̆ đei lơ bơngai kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ chu. Lu bơngai noh boih Môis anhăk đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Now with whom was He angry forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose corpses fell in the wilderness?
Bahnar: Kơplah puăn-jĭt sơnăm noh sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei hil kơ đe bu? Sư hil kơ lu bơngai Isơrael pơm yoch. 'Noh na lu sư lôch kơtă hloi tơ dêh glă.

English: And to whom did He swear that they would not enter His rest, but to those who did not obey?
Bahnar: Bĭ Sư khan: Iĕm ưh kơ gơh layơ wă mơ̆t pơdơh tơ dêh char Inh, noh Sư hil kơ đe bu? Sư hil kơ lu bơngai mă ưh kơ chu Sư.

English: So we see that they could not enter in because of unbelief.
Bahnar: 'Noh bơ̆n băt nhên boih, lu sư ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t pơdơh tơ dêh char Sư, yua kơ lu bơngai noh ưh kơ đei đon lui.

English: Therefore, since a promise remains of entering His rest, let us fear lest any of you seem to have come short of it.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m pơkă kơ bơ̆n gơh mơ̆t pơdơh tơ dêh char Sư, thoi noh na bơ̆n athei kơchăng tơpă hli kơ bơ̆n lê̆ tơdrong lui, Sư ưh kơ ăn mơ̆t.

English: For indeed the gospel was preached to us as well as to them; but the word which they heard did not profit them, not being mixed with faith in those who heard it.
Bahnar: Yua kơ bơ̆n kơtơ̆ng boih đe bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng, thoi lu bơngai noh kơtơ̆ng sơ̆, mă ưh kơ yua kiơ kơ lu bơngai noh, kơlih kơ lu sư ưh kơ wă lui.

English: For we who have believed do enter that rest, as He has said: “So I swore in My wrath, ‘They shall not enter My rest,’ ” although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
Bahnar: Pôm bơ̆n bơngai lui gô mơ̆t pơdơh hăm Sư tơpă, yua kơ bơ̆n băt kơ Sư khan kơ lu bơngai noh sơ̆ khan: “Inh hil kơ lu sư thoi âu: ‘Iĕm pơm thoi noh, iĕm ưh kơ gơh layơ wă mơ̆t pơdơh tơ dêh char Inh.’ ” Lu bơngai noh ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t pơdơh hăm Sư, ưh kơ sĭ yua kơ anih hnam ưh kơ mah dah ưh kơ đei. Ưh ôh. Anih hnam hăm tôm tơdrong nai Sư hơmet lê̆ đơ̆ng blŭng-a Sư pơjing plĕnh păng teh sơ̆ boih.

English: For He has spoken in a certain place of the seventh day in this way: “And God rested on the seventh day from all His works”
Bahnar: Yua kơ lăm hla bơar Sư kư̆m đei khan gah năr tơpơh noh sơ̆ thoi âu: “Truh năr tơpơh, 'Bok Kei-Dei pơdơh tôm kơ tơdrong jang Sư.”

English: and again in this place: “They shall not enter My rest.”
Bahnar: Na 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lu bơngai noh ưh kơ layơ gơh mơ̆t pơdơh hăm Sư tơ dêh char Sư, bơ̆n băt kơ Sư pơdơh boih gô kon bơngai pơdơh hơdai hăm Sư.

English: Since therefore it remains that some must enter it, and those to whom it was first preached did not enter because of disobedience
Bahnar: Lu bơngai noh sơ̆ kơtơ̆ng boih đe bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng, mă lu sư ưh kơ chu kuă kơ lui, noh na lu sư ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t pơdơh hăm Sư. Lu sư kuă lê̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơngai nai mơ̆t.

English: again He designates a certain day, saying in David, “Today,” after such a long time, as it has been said: “Today, if you will hear His voice, Do not harden your hearts.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh đunh tơpă đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Sư athei Đawit pơma thoi nơ̆r inh roi kơ iĕm tơ kơpal noh hei, Sư khan: “Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp mưh iĕm kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Inh pơma, iĕm 'nĕ pă arăng kơ̆l.” Thoi noh na ahrei Sư ăn kơ kon bơngai mơ̆t pơdơh hăm Sư boih.

English: For if Joshua had given them rest, then He would not afterward have spoken of another day.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ 'bok Jôsuê anhăk lu bôl sư bơngai Isơrael năm oei tơ minh pôm dêh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn. Mă ưh kơ sĭ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ lu bơngai chăl Đawit sơ̆ oei pơdơh hơdai hăm Sư tơ dêh char noh ôh. Sư khan noh oei đunh tơpă ưh kơ băt dôm jơhnơr, Sư khan lê̆ kơ lu bơngai chăl Đawit wă kơ lu bơngai noh chu kơ Sư, Sư wă ăn mơ̆t oei tơ dêh char Sư tơ plĕnh.

English: There remains therefore a rest for the people of God.
Bahnar: 'Noh na ahrei Sư wă ăn kơ lu kon Sư mơ̆t pơdơh tơ Sư ling-lang, kư̆m thoi Sư pơdơh kơ tơdrong jang Sư năr tơpơh 'noh sơ̆.

English: For he who has entered His rest has himself also ceased from his works as God did from His.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơdơh hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei, bơngai noh sư pơdơh kơ tơdrong jang Sư, thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơdơh kơ tơdrong jang Sư sơ̆.

English: Let us therefore be diligent to enter that rest, lest anyone fall according to the same example of disobedience.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n athei adrin lui mă tơpă wă kơ gơh mơ̆t pơdơh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng wă kơ bơ̆n huay kơ đei bu hiong kơ tơdrong 'noh thoi lu bơngai arăng kơ̆l kuă kơ lui sơ̆.

English: For the word of God is living and powerful, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the division of soul and spirit, and of joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
Bahnar: Yua kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang, jăng dêh păng han hloh kơ đao 'bar pah măt, 'bet han klĕch tơ sĕch huan kơting, hrĕch kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m đơ̆ng bơhngol. Tơdrong Sư sek tơlang bơ̆n thoi noh. Sư băt tôm tơdrong đon tơchĕng kon bơngai 'maih pơm.

English: And there is no creature hidden from His sight, but all things are naked and open to the eyes of Him to whom we must give account.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ mă hlơp kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ'ngla mă sek tơlang bơ̆n, Sư 'bôh nhên tôm tơdrong kon bơngai pơm.

English: Seeing then that we have a great High Priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n đei minh 'nu 'bok soi tih wei-lăng bơ̆n, Sư tŏk ưh kơ băt hơdôm tăl plĕnh, anăn Sư Yêsu Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei; noh na bơ̆n athei lui kơ Sư khŏm khŏm.

English: For we do not have a High Priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses, but was in all points tempted as we are, yet without sin.
Bahnar: Sư ưh kơ sĭ 'bok soi mă ưh kơ băt mơnat kơ kon bơngai rơdu tơrăn ôh. Sư mơnat kơ bơ̆n tơpă, yua kơ Sư mơn kơdih hơdai đei tơdrong pơhlŭ thoi kon bơngai bơ̆n. Gah tơdrong pơm yoch, Sư ưh kơ đei pơm yoch kiơ ôh.

English: Let us therefore come boldly to the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy and find grace to help in time of need.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bĕ bơ̆n năm jê̆ tơ anăp Sư. Huay kơ hli ôh, Sư mơnat kơ bơ̆n tơpă, Sư wă tơgŭm bơ̆n lơ̆m dôm tơdrong bơ̆n kăl yua.

English: For every high priest taken from among men is appointed for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins.
Bahnar: Rim 'nu lu 'bok soi tih 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk sư đơ̆ng khŭl kon bơngai wă jang tang lu bôl sư lơ̆m tơdrong soi sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong yoch lu bôl sư.

English: He can have compassion on those who are ignorant and going astray, since he himself is also subject to weakness.
Bahnar: Lu sư băt mơnat kơ lu bơngai mă kơhlôh kơwao, lu bơngai yoch, yua kơ lu sư kư̆m hơdai tơrăn lei-lăi thoi lu bôl buăl.

English: Because of this he is required as for the people, so also for himself, to offer sacrifices for sins.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu bôl buăl đĕch ôh, lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih hai.

English: And no man takes this honor to himself, but he who is called by God, just as Aaron was.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơm 'bok soi tih, tơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ rơih iŏk, kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơm kơdih ôh; đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk na kon bơngai gơh pơm. Thoi 'bok Arôn sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk 'mơ̆i na sư gơh pơm 'bok soi tih.

English: So also Christ did not glorify Himself to become High Priest, but it was He who said to Him: “You are My Son, Today I have begotten You.”
Bahnar: Yêsu Krist kư̆m thoi noh, Sư ưh kơ gơh pôk akâu Sư kơdih pơm 'bok soi tih ôh, 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk Sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Ih boih Kon Inh, năr âu Inh wă ăn kơ Ih pơgơ̆r.”

English: As He also says in another place: “You are a priest forever According to the order of Melchizedek”
Bahnar: Tơ anih nai Sư kư̆m đei khan thoi âu: “Ih pơm 'bok soi ling-lang ưh kơ tôch, kiơ̆ kơ Ih adrĕch pơm tih thoi Mêlkisêdek.”

English: who, in the days of His flesh, when He had offered up prayers and supplications, with vehement cries and tears to Him who was able to save Him from death, and was heard because of His godly fear
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei tơ teh âu sơ̆, Sư krao pơret 'Bă Sư păng hmoi apơi kơ 'Bă Sư, yua kơ Sư băt kơ 'Bă Sư gơh tơdŏng Sư đơ̆ng tơdrong lôch. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆ng Sư, yua kơ Sư chu yom kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: though He was a Son, yet He learned obedience by the things which He suffered.
Bahnar: Mă khan Sư Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư kư̆m hơdai pơmat-tat, na Sư băt kơ adrin chu yom kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And having been perfected, He became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey Him
Bahnar: Sư pơm dôm tơdrong tơnen 'blep thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei, na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Sư pơm tơm gah tơdrong dŏng pơklaih dôm lu bơngai mă băt chu kơ Kon Sư, đơ̆ng tơdrong phak ăn arih ling-lang

English: called by God as High Priest “according to the order of Melchizedek,”
Bahnar: yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk Sư pơm 'bok soi tih kiơ̆ kơ Sư adrĕch tih Mêlkisêdek.

English: of whom we have much to say, and hard to explain, since you have become dull of hearing.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong 'bok 'noh inh 'maih roi tơblang kơ iĕm, mă inh gleh 'biơ̆ tơblang kơ iĕm, yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ gan hlôh.

English: For though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you again the first principles of the oracles of God; and you have come to need milk and not solid food.
Bahnar: Iĕm lui đunh boih, trŏ kơ iĕm pơm 'bok bơtho, bơtho lu bơngai nai dơ̆ng, mă iĕm âu oei kăl kơ đe bơtho iĕm, dang đe bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ lu bơngai 'nao lui. 'Noh inh băt kơ iĕm oei gĭt kơ đak toh đĕch, ưh tam gơh ăn kơ iĕm sa tơmam arăng ôh.

English: For everyone who partakes only of milk is unskilled in the word of righteousness, for he is a babe.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu oei gĭt kơ đak toh, bơngai 'noh oei 'lơ̆p tơpă. Sư ưh tam hlôh wao tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong kơnê̆ ôh.

English: But solid food belongs to those who are of full age, that is, those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.
Bahnar: Pôm lu bơngai pơm kră đĕch gơh sa tơmam arăng, lu sư pơhrăm đunh boih, lu sư băt kơnăl kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, tơdrong kơnê̆ boih.

English: Therefore, leaving the discussion of the elementary principles of Christ, let us go on to perfection, not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works and of faith toward God
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei bơ̆n ưh kơ kăl boih pơhrăm dơ̆ng dôm tơdrong mă bơ̆n 'nao pơtơm lui kơ Yêsu, tơdrong mă tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, tơdrong lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: of the doctrine of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
Bahnar: tơdrong iŏk 'batem, tơdrong krao khan pel kơ̆l wă kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng jur oei, tơdrong kon bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang ning-mônh wă phak ling-lang dôm lu bơngai mă kuă kơ lui kơ Sư. Dôm tơdrong noh bơ̆n ưh kơ kăl kơ pơhrăm dơ̆ng boih, yua kơ lu bơ̆n đêl pơhrăm ngăl boih.

English: And this we will do if God permits.
Bahnar: Na dang ei, dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn, bơ̆n gơh pơhrăm pơthim lơ̆m tơdrong nai 'biơ̆ wă kơ mă jrŭ.

English: For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted the heavenly gift, and have become partakers of the Holy Spirit
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah lu bơngai mă băt nhên boih tơdrong Yêsu, 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư arih 'nao, ăn kơ sư Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng oei hơdai hăm sư

English: and have tasted the good word of God and the powers of the age to come
Bahnar: sư băt kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng tơpă boih, sư 'bôh nhên boih tơdrong mơsêh Yêsu kư̆m lei-lăi thoi Sư wă pơgơ̆r ning-mônh

English: if they fall away, to renew them again to repentance, since they crucify again for themselves the Son of God, and put Him to an open shame.
Bahnar: mă sư lê̆ tơdrong lui sư, bơngai noh bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh pơlung sư wih dơ̆ng tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, kơlih kơ Sư dang pơ̆ng pơlơ̆k Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ 'long pơglang, oei wă pơ'brơh kơ Sư khŏm khŏm 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl lơ.

English: For the earth which drinks in the rain that often comes upon it, and bears herbs useful for those by whom it is cultivated, receives blessing from God
Bahnar: Pơtih gia kơ teh ayơ mă 'lơ̆ng, đei đak 'mi mah pơjing kơ hla 'long bluh 'lơ̆ng, đei plei trem, noh wă pơyua kơ tơ'ngla mă jang pơtăm sư, teh noh 'Bok Kei-Dei mơnat ăn kơ sư pơjing hla 'long bluh 'lơ̆ng đei yua khŏm khŏm.

English: but if it bears thorns and briers, it is rejected and near to being cursed, whose end is to be burned.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah teh noh pơjing 'bĕnh kơ 'nhĕt jơla uh-un, teh noh ưh kơ yua kiơ, tŭk đĕch, tơpo hơtuch soh tŭk tăm. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m pơm kơ kon bơngai bơ̆n thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: But, beloved, we are confident of better things concerning you, yes, things that accompany salvation, though we speak in this manner.
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh mă nhôn 'mêm kơeng, nhôn pơma pơtrŏ đĕch nhôn pơma thoi noh, mă tơpă nhôn băt kơ iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng pơm trŏ, yua kơ iĕm hơdai wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei iŏk iĕm.

English: For God is not unjust to forget your work and labor of love which you have shown toward His name, in that you have ministered to the saints, and do minister.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư tơpăt dêh, Sư ưh kơ hiơt ôh dôm tơdrong jang iĕm mă sơ̆ mă dang ei, tơdrong iĕm 'mêm mơnat dih băl, tơdrong iĕm tơgŭm băl tơduă kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ iĕm băt 'mêm kơ Sư.

English: And we desire that each one of you show the same diligence to the full assurance of hope until the end
Bahnar: Nhôn wă đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm adrin pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh ling-lang truh kơ tôch, na iĕm gô đei tơpă tơdrong mă iĕm oei chang sơmĕng dang ei noh.

English: that you do not become sluggish, but imitate those who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
Bahnar: Nhôn ưh kơ wă kơ iĕm alah ôh; nhôn wă kơ iĕm adrin lui kiơ̆ mă trŏ thoi lu đe kră sơ̆, lu sư lui khŏm khŏm tơpă, na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơpă tôm tơdrong mă Sư đêl pơkă.

English: For when God made a promise to Abraham, because He could swear by no one greater, He swore by Himself
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt kon bơngai, mưh wă pơkă băl tơdrong kiơ wă kơ kơjăp, sư pao anăn tơ'ngla Kră Yang sư kơdih wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ nơ̆r sư. Kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ Abraham sơ̆, Sư wă kơ đe băt kơ Sư gô tơgŭm tơpă, na Sư ưh kơ đei pao anăn bu nai ôh yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu tih hloh kơ Sư, Sư pao anăn Sư kơdih đĕch. Sư khan kơ Abraham thoi âu: “Inh wă tơgŭm ih tơpă, Inh gô ăn kơ ih đei lu kon sâu lơ.” Abraham lui tơpă, sư chang gô truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư tơpă.

English: saying, “Surely blessing I will bless you, and multiplying I will multiply you.”
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt kon bơngai, mưh wă pơkă băl tơdrong kiơ wă kơ kơjăp, sư pao anăn tơ'ngla Kră Yang sư kơdih wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ nơ̆r sư. Kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ Abraham sơ̆, Sư wă kơ đe băt kơ Sư gô tơgŭm tơpă, na Sư ưh kơ đei pao anăn bu nai ôh yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu tih hloh kơ Sư, Sư pao anăn Sư kơdih đĕch. Sư khan kơ Abraham thoi âu: “Inh wă tơgŭm ih tơpă, Inh gô ăn kơ ih đei lu kon sâu lơ.” Abraham lui tơpă, sư chang gô truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư tơpă.

English: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt kon bơngai, mưh wă pơkă băl tơdrong kiơ wă kơ kơjăp, sư pao anăn tơ'ngla Kră Yang sư kơdih wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ nơ̆r sư. Kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ Abraham sơ̆, Sư wă kơ đe băt kơ Sư gô tơgŭm tơpă, na Sư ưh kơ đei pao anăn bu nai ôh yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu tih hloh kơ Sư, Sư pao anăn Sư kơdih đĕch. Sư khan kơ Abraham thoi âu: “Inh wă tơgŭm ih tơpă, Inh gô ăn kơ ih đei lu kon sâu lơ.” Abraham lui tơpă, sư chang gô truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư tơpă.

English: For men indeed swear by the greater, and an oath for confirmation is for them an end of all dispute.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt kon bơngai, mưh wă pơkă băl tơdrong kiơ wă kơ kơjăp, sư pao anăn tơ'ngla Kră Yang sư kơdih wă kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai lui kơ nơ̆r sư. Kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ Abraham sơ̆, Sư wă kơ đe băt kơ Sư gô tơgŭm tơpă, na Sư ưh kơ đei pao anăn bu nai ôh yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu tih hloh kơ Sư, Sư pao anăn Sư kơdih đĕch. Sư khan kơ Abraham thoi âu: “Inh wă tơgŭm ih tơpă, Inh gô ăn kơ ih đei lu kon sâu lơ.” Abraham lui tơpă, sư chang gô truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư tơpă.

English: Thus God, determining to show more abundantly to the heirs of promise the immutability of His counsel, confirmed it by an oath
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơbăt kơ lu bơngai mă Sư pơkă, wă kơ lu bơngai noh băt kơ tơdrong Sư pơkă gô đei tơpă, na Sư pao anăn Sư kơdih.

English: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the Most High God, who met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him
Bahnar: 'Bok soi Mêlkisêdek sư pơm pơtao Pơlei Salem, sư kư̆m pơm 'bok soi wă soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Sư năm sơng iŏk Abraham brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah kơ lu pơtao nai. Na sư krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm Abraham.

English: to whom also Abraham gave a tenth part of all, first being translated “king of righteousness,” and then also king of Salem, meaning “king of peace,”
Bahnar: Abraham iŏk dôm tơmam sư minh lơ̆m mơjĭt asong kơ Mêlkisêdek. Anăn Mêlkisêdek wă khan 'bok pơtao 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Pơtao đe Salem, Salem wă khan hiôk-hian, sư 'bok pơtao pơgơ̆r tơdrong hiôk-hian.

English: without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like the Son of God, remains a priest continually.
Bahnar: Mêlkisêdek bơ̆n ưh kơ 'bôh đe chih roi lăm hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sư đei mĕ 'bă, đei adrĕch adrung, dah đei đe tơpŭ kơ sư, dah roi tơdrong sư lôch ôh. Sư thoi lĕ kơ Yêsu Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ sư pơm 'bok soi pơgơ̆r ling-lang.

English: Now consider how great this man was, to whom even the patriarch Abraham gave a tenth of the spoils.
Bahnar: Sư 'bok tih tơpă bĭ iĕm tơchĕng sư thoi yơ? 'Bok kơdră bơ̆n Abraham sơ̆ mah asong sư tơmam đơ̆ng sư blah iŏk tơmam lu ayăt, ăn kơ sư minh lơ̆m mơjĭt.

English: And indeed those who are of the sons of Levi, who receive the priesthood, have a commandment to receive tithes from the people according to the law, that is, from their brethren, though they have come from the loins of Abraham
Bahnar: Lu kon sâu 'bok Lêwi mă pơm 'bok soi kư̆m gơh iŏk tơmam pơyơ̆r minh lơ̆m mơjĭt đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei pơla 'nhŏng oh lu sư, yua kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă thoi noh păng lu sư kư̆m kon sâu Abraham tăm.

English: but he whose genealogy is not derived from them received tithes from Abraham and blessed him who had the promises.
Bahnar: Mă Mêlkisêdek sư ưh kơ trŏ kơ kon sâu 'bok Lêwi ôh, mă-lei sư kư̆m gơh iŏk tơmam minh lơ̆m mơjĭt đơ̆ng Abraham. Na sư krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm Abraham bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă tơgŭm.

English: Now beyond all contradiction the lesser is blessed by the better.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na ưh kơ đei bu pơma kiơ kơ Mêlkisêdek gah tơdrong sư krao khan kơ Abraham, yua kơ sư tih hloh kơ Abraham tơpă.

English: Here mortal men receive tithes, but there he receives them, of whom it is witnessed that he lives.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi kon sâu 'bok Lêwi, mă khan sư gơh iŏk sa tơmam kon pơlei pơyơ̆r minh lơ̆m mơjĭt, mă-lei lu kon sâu sư noh sơ̆ lôch đĭ boih. Mă gah Mêlkisêdek, lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sư oei arih ưh kơ lôch ôh.

English: Even Levi, who receives tithes, paid tithes through Abraham, so to speak
Bahnar: Lêwi ưh kơ đei ăn kơ Mêlkisêdek tơmam minh lơ̆m mơjĭt ôh, Abraham đĕch ăn. Mă-lei kư̆m dang sư ăn mơ̆n

English: for he was still in the loins of his father when Melchizedek met him.
Bahnar: yua kơ kơplah Mêlkisêdek năm sơng iŏk Abraham brŏk đơ̆ng tơblah, Lêwi dang lĕ kơ kon pơjing Abraham yua kơ sư kon sâu Abraham.

English: Therefore, if perfection were through the Levitical priesthood (for under it the people received the law), what further need was there that another priest should rise according to the order of Melchizedek, and not be called according to the order of Aaron?
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi kon sâu 'bok Lêwi hăm 'bok Arôn pơgơ̆r gah tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ lu bơngai Isơrael. Tơ̆ng kon bơngai gơnang kơ lu sư, na gơh jing 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei, lei kon bơngai ưh pă kăl boih kơ 'bok soi tih adrĕch Mêlkisêdek jur pơgơ̆r. Dôm lu sư jang mah boih.

English: For the priesthood being changed, of necessity there is also a change of the law.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơplih pôk 'bok soi 'nao, lei tơdrong juăt Sư pơkă sơ̆ Sư kư̆m athei tơplih.

English: For He of whom these things are spoken belongs to another tribe, from which no man has officiated at the altar.
Bahnar: Yŏng bơ̆n Yêsu Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk pơm 'bok soi dang ei, Sư ưh kơ sĭ adrĕch adrung 'bok Lêwi ôh.

English: For it is evident that our Lord arose from Judah, of which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood.
Bahnar: Sư adrĕch adrung Juđa. Adrĕch adrung Juđa, Môis ưh kơ đei roi bu lơ̆m lu sư pơm 'bok soi ôh. Thoi noh tam mă đei bu đơ̆ng adrĕch lu sư pơm 'bok soi.

English: And it is yet far more evident if, in the likeness of Melchizedek, there arises another priest
Bahnar: Dang ei bơ̆n băt nhên boih bơ̆n đei minh 'nu 'bok soi 'nao, Yêsu Krist, Sư adrĕch pơm tih thoi Mêlkisêdek.

English: who has come, not according to the law of a fleshly commandment, but according to the power of an endless life.
Bahnar: Tơdrong Sư pơm 'bok soi tih ưh kơ sĭ Sư pơm kiơ̆ kơ adrĕch Sư pơm 'bok soi kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt pơkă sơ̆ ôh. Sư pơm 'bok soi tih yua kơ Sư mơsêh arih ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch na Sư pơm.

English: For He testifies: “You are a priest forever According to the order of Melchizedek.”
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Ih pơm 'bok soi ling-lang ưh kơ tôch kiơ̆ kơ Ih adrĕch pơm tih thoi Mêlkisêdek.”

English: For on the one hand there is an annulling of the former commandment because of its weakness and unprofitableness
Bahnar: Thoi noh na tơdrong juăt Môis noh sơ̆, 'Bok Kei-Dei tŭk lê̆ boih, yua kơ tơdrong juăt noh ưh kơ pơyua kon bơngai.

English: for the law made nothing perfect; on the other hand, there is the bringing in of a better hope, through which we draw near to God.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng kon bơngai kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt noh sơ̆, kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh. Mă-lei dang ei bơ̆n jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt boih, yua kơ 'bok soi 'nao noh, Sư soi akâu Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na dang ei bơ̆n pơ̆n năm jê̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih.

English: And inasmuch as He was not made priest without an oath
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk Yêsu pơm 'bok soi noh, Sư pao anăn Sư kơdih pơkă kơjăp tơpă.

English: (for they have become priests without an oath, but He with an oath by Him who said to Him: “The LORD has sworn And will not relent, ‘You are a priest forever According to the order of Melchizedek’ ”)
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei đei khan thoi âu: “Inh Kră Yang, Inh pao anăn Inh kơdih pơkă kơjăp tơpă, Inh ưh kơ gơh lê̆ ôh tơdrong pơkă noh.” Tơdrong pơkă noh Sư khan kơ Kon Sư thoi âu: “Ih pơm 'bok soi ling-lang ưh kơ tôch.” Mă kơplah Sư ăn lu bơngai noh pơm 'bok soi sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei pao anăn Sư kơdih pơkă kơjăp thoi noh ôh.

English: by so much more Jesus has become a surety of a better covenant.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na bơ̆n băt kơ Yêsu pơgơ̆p bơ̆n kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei dang ei hiôk hloh kơ lu 'bok soi noh pơgơ̆p sơ̆.

English: Also there were many priests, because they were prevented by death from continuing.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi noh sơ̆ lu sư lơ, mă lơ yua kơ nŏng kơ pơtăl băl kơlih kơ lôch.

English: But He, because He continues forever, has an unchangeable priesthood.
Bahnar: Mă gah Yêsu Sư oei pơm ling-lang ưh kơ tôch, yua kơ Sư gơh arih ling-lang.

English: Therefore He is also able to save to the uttermost those who come to God through Him, since He always lives to make intercession for them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na mă layơ Sư oei pơklaih ling-lang dôm lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ Sư, wă kơ bơ̆n gơh brŏk tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, kơlih kơ Sư arih ling-lang ưh kơ tôch. Păng Sư oei apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang wă tơgŭm bơ̆n.

English: For such a High Priest was fitting for us, who is holy, harmless, undefiled, separate from sinners, and has become higher than the heavens
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơ̆n băt kơ Yêsu boih pơm 'bok soi tih gơh tơgŭm bơ̆n tơpă. Sư 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ưh kơ lah pơm yoch, lu bơngai yoch kư̆m ưh kơ gơh pơhlŭ Sư pơm kơnê̆. Sư mơsêh tŏk oei ưh kơ băt hơdôm tăl plĕnh.

English: who does not need daily, as those high priests, to offer up sacrifices, first for His own sins and then for the people’s, for this He did once for all when He offered up Himself.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi nai, rim năr lu sư soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư soi pơ'lơ̆ng gah tơdrong yoch lu sư kơdih 'mơ̆i, na soi kơ lu kon pơlei pơla. Mă-lei gah Yêsu ưh ôh, Sư soi akâu Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei minh 'măng tơ 'long pơglang tôm boih.

English: For the law appoints as high priests men who have weakness, but the word of the oath, which came after the law, appoints the Son who has been perfected forever.
Bahnar: Tơdrong juăt sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei pôk kon bơngai pơm 'bok soi tih, pôk tă kơ lu kon bơngai bơ̆n rơdu tơrăn ngăl. Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong juăt noh, 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơjăp tơpă pôk Kon Sư kơdih pơm 'bok soi hloi, Kon Sư pơm tôm tơdrong 'blep trŏ ling-lang.

English: Now this is the main point of the things we are saying: We have such a High Priest, who is seated at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong inh pơma kơ iĕm dang ei, tơdrong âu kăl tơpă, thoi inh roi kơ iĕm tơ kơpal noh hei: Bơ̆n đei minh 'nu 'bok soi tih, Sư oei gah 'ma kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti.

English: a Minister of the sanctuary and of the true tabernacle which the Lord erected, and not man.
Bahnar: Sư jang tơ lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti, tơ lăm anih mă 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hloi. Hnam noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing 'lơ̆ng tơpă, 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei mă kon bơngai pơm tơ teh âu.

English: For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices. Therefore it is necessary that this One also have something to offer.
Bahnar: Rim kơ đe pôk pơm 'bok soi tih, đe wă kơ lu 'bok soi noh soi tơmam kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei; thoi noh na Yêsu kư̆m đei tơmam Sư wă soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: For if He were on earth, He would not be a priest, since there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng Yêsu oei tơ teh, đe ưh kơ ăn Sư pơm 'bok soi ôh, kơlih kơ Sư adrĕch adrung kon sâu bơngai nai, ưh kơ trŏ kơ adrĕch adrung lu bơngai noh. Lu bơngai noh lu sư adrĕch adrung 'bok Lêwi, lu sư soi kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆.

English: who serve the copy and shadow of the heavenly things, as Moses was divinely instructed when he was about to make the tabernacle. For He said, “See that you make all things according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.”
Bahnar: Lu sư jang awih tơ lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ teh âu. Hnam lu sư pơm pơtrŏ thoi hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ kơpal plĕnh ti. Hnam tơ plĕnh ti 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơpă. 'Noh thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei khan boih kơ Môis, kơplah mă Môis wă pơtơm pơm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei păng tua-la-tăng sơ̆. 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi âu: “Ih athei kơchăng pơm mă trŏ kiơ̆ thoi Inh tơ'bôh kơ ih tơ kông ki.”

English: But now He has obtained a more excellent ministry, inasmuch as He is also Mediator of a better covenant, which was established on better promises.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yêsu đei tơdrong jang tih hloh kơ tơdrong jang lu 'bok soi noh. Rai pơthim dơ̆ng kơ Sư pơm 'long sơlam pơgơ̆p kon bơngai kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơdrong pơgơ̆p noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p so, yua kơ Sư pơkă wă tơgŭm bơ̆n dang ei 'lơ̆ng hloh.

English: For if that first covenant had been faultless, then no place would have been sought for a second.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng tơdrong pơgơ̆p so pơyua kon bơngai tơpă, lei ưh kơ kăl kơ pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao ôh.

English: Because finding fault with them, He says: “Behold, the days are coming, says the LORD, when I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na Kră Yang hil kơ lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p so: Kră Yang khan thoi âu: “Ning-mônh Inh gô pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao kơ lu bơngai Juđê hăm đĭ kơ lu bơngai Isơrael nai.

English: not according to the covenant that I made with their fathers in the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because they did not continue in My covenant, and I disregarded them, says the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao ei ưh pă thoi tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă Inh pơjing ăn kơ lu yă 'bok iĕm kơplah mă Inh chông ba lu sư jăk đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ sơ̆ ôh. Tơdrong pơgơ̆p noh sơ̆ lu sư kuă kơ kiơ̆. Thoi noh na Inh achăng lê̆ lu sư, Kră Yang khan.

English: For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel after those days, says the LORD: I will put My laws in their mind and write them on their hearts; and I will be their God, and they shall be My people.
Bahnar: Păng ning-mônh Inh wă pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao kơ lu bơngai Isơrael thoi âu: Inh wă tah tơdrong juăt Inh pơkă tơ lăm đon tơchĕng lu sư, Inh wă chih tơ'băk tơdrong juăt Inh tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư, Inh pơm Kră Yang lu sư, lu sư gô jing kon pơlei pơla Inh.

English: None of them shall teach his neighbor, and none his brother, saying, ‘Know the LORD,’ for all shall know Me, from the least of them to the greatest of them.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh lu sư ưh pă kăl kơ pơtơm băl lui kơ Inh boih, yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu sư đơ̆ng 'lơ̆p truh tơ kră băt kơ Inh ngăl boih.

English: For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness, and their sins and their lawless deeds I will remember no more.”
Bahnar: Inh gô mơnat kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư đêl pơm, Inh ưh pă tơchĕng boih kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh.”

English: In that He says, “A new covenant,” He has made the first obsolete. Now what is becoming obsolete and growing old is ready to vanish away.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma dơ̆ng gah tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao, Sư jô̆ kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p hơdrol sơ̆ thoi lĕ kơ so boih. Tơdrong kiơ so, tơdrong noh wă jê̆ hiong tôch boih.

English: Then indeed, even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service and the earthly sanctuary.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆p hơdrol sơ̆, đei tơdrong juăt pơkă gah tơdrong kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, đei hnam kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă kon bơngai pơm.

English: For a tabernacle was prepared: the first part, in which was the lampstand, the table, and the showbread, which is called the sanctuary
Bahnar: Hnam noh đe pơm păng tua-la-tăng đei 'bar tŏ lăm, rŏ dêh. Lăm mă mônh đe 'măn jơ̆ng kơđeng păng chơnang soi wă 'măn 'bĕng mi đơ̆ng đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Anih noh đe anăn anih giĕng soi.

English: and behind the second veil, the part of the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of All
Bahnar: Tơ rŏng, mơ̆t kơ 'măng mă 'bar đei anih lăm. Anih noh đe anăn anih giĕng soi tih.

English: which had the golden censer and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold, in which were the golden pot that had the manna, Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant
Bahnar: Lăm noh đei chơnang soi maih đe tơ̆k ŭnh soh pơgang 'bâu phu. Lăm noh kư̆m đei minh pôm hom tih đe kư̆m hling păng maih mơ̆n. Lơ̆m hom noh đe tah tơmo lat chih tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ kon bơngai, tah kơlăm maih wă mong 'bĕng mana mă huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh sơ̆, hăm tah 'long jra 'bok Arôn mă chăt pơkao.

English: and above it were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat. Of these things we cannot now speak in detail.
Bahnar: Kơpal hom noh đe man 'bar tŏ rup linh jang 'lơ̆ng, đe anăn bre sư chêrôbin, bre sư bơyar pơnăr tơ kơpal kơ hom noh. Hom noh đe anăn anih 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch, 'bar tŏ rup linh jang noh wă pơtih gia kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei oei lơ̆m anih noh. Inh kư̆m wă roi kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong noh, mă inh ưh kơ wăn ôh.

English: Now when these things had been thus prepared, the priests always went into the first part of the tabernacle, performing the services.
Bahnar: Đe pơm tôm tơdrong lơ̆m hnam noh keh boih, na lu 'bok soi ling-lang juăt kơ mơ̆t kơkuh soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ lơ̆m anih giĕng mă mônh noh.

English: But into the second part the high priest went alone once a year, not without blood, which he offered for himself and for the people’s sins committed in ignorance
Bahnar: Gah lăm mă 'bar lăp minh 'nu 'bok soi tih đĕch gơh mơ̆t kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lơ̆m noh. Mă-lei minh sơnăm minh 'măng đĕch, mă mơ̆t athei yua hăm pham sem dơrong 'mơ̆i na gơh mơ̆t, iŏk pham sem noh soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei huay kơ jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong yoch sư kơdih hăm tơdrong yoch lu bôl buăl sư bơngai Isơrael.

English: the Holy Spirit indicating this, that the way into the Holiest of All was not yet made manifest while the first tabernacle was still standing.
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư bơtho kơ bơ̆n wă kơ bơ̆n băt, sơ̆ bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ anih giĕng tih.

English: It was symbolic for the present time in which both gifts and sacrifices are offered which cannot make him who performed the service perfect in regard to the conscience
Bahnar: Tơdrong noh Sư tơbăt ăn kơ lu bơ̆n dang ei ưh pă giĕng năm 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei boih. Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong so noh sơ̆, lu 'bok soi, lu sư đei tơmam đe pơyơ̆r wă soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Mă-lei tơdrong lu sư soi noh ưh kơ pơm kơ lu bơngai mă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.

English: concerned only with foods and drinks, various washings, and fleshly ordinances imposed until the time of reformation.
Bahnar: Lu tơdrong juăt noh sơ̆ khă gah tơdrong sa et tơmam giĕng, tơdrong hum 'nhao. Dôm tơdrong giĕng lu sư pơm giĕng tơ 'ngoaih akâu đĕch. Mă-lei khan wă kơ đe kiơ̆ khŏm khŏm truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơplih tơdrong so ăn tơdrong 'nao.

English: But Christ came as High Priest of the good things to come, with the greater and more perfect tabernacle not made with hands, that is, not of this creation.
Bahnar: Na dang ei Yêsu Krist truh boih, Sư pơm 'bok soi ăn dôm tơdrong hiôk 'lơ̆ng kơ bơ̆n. Sư jang awih awăn tơ lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei rŏ hloh kơ hnam akŭm lu bơngai noh sơ̆. Hnam Sư ei ưh kơ pơm păng ti kon bơngai ôh păng hnam ei ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơ teh âu ôh, hnam ei tơ plĕnh ti.

English: Not with the blood of goats and calves, but with His own blood He entered the Most Holy Place once for all, having obtained eternal redemption.
Bahnar: Yêsu mơ̆t boih hnam ei, truh tơ anih giĕng tih hloi. Sư mơ̆t soi minh 'măng đĕch tôm hloi kơ tơdrong soi boih yua kơ Sư soi hăm pham Sư kơdih. Ưh kơ sĭ Sư soi hăm pham bơbe pham rơmo ôh. Sư soi thoi noh đĕch, na bu wă gơnang kơ tơdrong Sư soi noh, bơngai noh gô klaih hloi kơ tơdrong yoch.

English: For if the blood of bulls and goats and the ashes of a heifer, sprinkling the unclean, sanctifies for the purifying of the flesh
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch pel 'bơm ưh kơ lăp, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt so sơ̆, athei pơ'lơ̆ng hăm pham bơbe pham rơmo tơno păng iŏk hơyok kon rơmo adruh đêl đe 'buh pơkhoy tuh bơlŭ hăm đak, na sraih lu bơngai mă đei tơdrong yoch noh na klaih, jô̆ jing bơngai rơgoh boih.

English: how much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself without spot to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng thoi ei, lei pham Yêsu Krist kăl hloh kơ dôm lu pham sem noh, yua kơ Sư rơgoh ling-lang ưh kơ đei yoch kiơ ôh. Pơthim kơ Sư Yang arih ling-lang tăm. Sư soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm pham Sư kơdih, na pham Sư sut lê̆ đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch bơ̆n, pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m đon bơ̆n jing 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ bơ̆n gơh jang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang.

English: And for this reason He is the Mediator of the new covenant, by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions under the first covenant, that those who are called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơ̆n băt lăp pôm Yêsu đĕch boih gơh pơm 'long sơlam kơ bơ̆n kiơ̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao, wă kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơ̆n bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei krao iŏk, gô đei tơdrong Sư pơkă wă ăn kơ bơ̆n ning-mônh ei. Dôm lu bơngai noh gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch đêl kiơ̆ tơdrong pơgơ̆p so, yua kơ Yêsu lôch huai iŏk sư.

English: For where there is a testament, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao kư̆m thoi tơdrong bơ̆n dô̆ asong mŭk kră, tơ̆ng kră tam mă lôch, ưh kơ gơh dô̆ asong ôh.

English: For a testament is in force after men are dead, since it has no power at all while the testator lives.
Bahnar: Gô sư lôch 'mơ̆i na gơh dô̆ asong kiơ̆ thoi sư pơkă.

English: Therefore not even the first covenant was dedicated without blood.
Bahnar: Tơdrong pơgơ̆p so kư̆m lei-lăi, đei pham 'mơ̆i na gơh pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p noh.

English: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and goats, with water, scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people
Bahnar: Kơplah Môis pơkă ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael tôm kơ tơdrong juăt boih, na sư phĕ iŏk tơ'mơ̆ng pơkao păng iŏk achô̆ sŏk bơbe, tong tơ lăm pham bơbe pham rơmo bơlŭ păng đak 'blăng na chruih kơ tơmo lat chih tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei, klaih kơ noh sư tơtreh kơ lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: saying, “This is the blood of the covenant which God has commanded you.”
Bahnar: Păng khan: “Pham âu, pham tơdrong pơgơ̆p mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă kơ iĕm rok kiơ̆.”

English: Then likewise he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry.
Bahnar: Sư chruih pham tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆ kư̆m lei-lăi thoi noh. Sư kư̆m chruih tôm kơ tơmam đe wă yua kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm noh.

English: And according to the law almost all things are purified with blood, and without shedding of blood there is no remission.
Bahnar: Kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt sơ̆, dôm tơdrong rơgoh, tă rơgoh yua kơ pham. Tơ̆ng ưh kơ huach pham, ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch ôh.

English: Therefore it was necessary that the copies of the things in the heavens should be purified with these, but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
Bahnar: Dôm tơdrong rơgoh noh sơ̆, rơgoh yua kơ đe soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm pham sem. Dôm tơdrong rơgoh noh, wă pơtih gia kơ tơdrong tơ plĕnh ti. Tơdrong tơ plĕnh ti kăl hloh. Na lu bơ̆n bơngai wă tŏk tơ plĕnh ti, wă gơnang kơ pham sem thoi lu bơngai noh sơ̆, ưh kơ gơh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch ôh. Bơ̆n athei gơnang kơ pham tơ'ngla mă soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm pham Sư kơdih noh đĕch klaih.

English: For Christ has not entered the holy places made with hands, which are copies of the true, but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei Yêsu Krist tŏk tơ plĕnh ti mơ̆t tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti boih. Sư ưh kơ mơ̆t tơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei mă kon bơngai pơm tơ teh âu ôh, hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei mă kon bơngai pơm tơ teh âu noh, wă pơtih gia kơ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti. Dang ei Yêsu Krist tŏk oei tơ noh tơpă boih, Sư oei 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei tang đĭ-đăng rim 'nu bơngai.

English: not that He should offer Himself often, as the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood of another
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ Sư soi hăm pham sem dơrong ôh, Sư soi hăm pham Sư kơdih hloi. Mă-lei ưh kơ sĭ soi akâu Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang thoi 'bok soi tih sơ̆ ôh, mơ̆t soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang, rim sơnăm minh 'măng, tơ anih giĕng tih hăm pham sem dơrong.

English: He then would have had to suffer often since the foundation of the world; but now, once at the end of the ages, He has appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of Himself.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng Sư soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei akâu Sư lơ 'măng, lei Sư lôch pơmat rim sơnăm jô̆ đơ̆ng pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei ưh kơ băt hơdôm 'măng. Mă tơpă Sư jur minh 'măng sơ̆ đĕch, yua kơ trŏ năr hơtuch boih. Sư jur soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei akâu Sư, wă pơrăm đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch.

English: And as it is appointed for men to die once, but after this the judgment
Bahnar: Kon bơngai bơ̆n lôch minh 'măng đĕch, klaih kơ noh năm tơ tơdrong sek tơlang.

English: so Christ was offered once to bear the sins of many. To those who eagerly wait for Him He will appear a second time, apart from sin, for salvation.
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh Yêsu jur lôch minh 'măng noh sơ̆ wă pơrăm tôm tơdrong yoch hloi. Mă pă 'măng Sư jur Sư ưh pă pơrăm tơdrong yoch boih, Sư jur wă iŏk dôm lu bơngai mă oei chang gô Sư dang ei.

English: For the law, having a shadow of the good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with these same sacrifices, which they offer continually year by year, make those who approach perfect.
Bahnar: Tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆, wă pơtih gia kơ dôm tơdrong hiôk 'lơ̆ng wă truh đơ̆ng rŏng. Mă-lei tơdrong juăt noh sơ̆ ưh kơ lei-lăi thoi tơdrong mă wă truh noh ôh. Thoi noh na lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt so noh, lu sư oei gơnang kơ tơdrong soi sơmah ling-lang rim sơnăm oei hơnơ̆ng thoi đêl. Pơm thoi noh lu sư ưh kơ jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh.

English: For then would they not have ceased to be offered? For the worshipers, once purified, would have had no more consciousness of sins.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng tơdrong soi gơh pơklaih lu sư đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch tơpă, lei thoi yơ lu sư oei soi ling-lang? Tơ̆ng lu sư klaih tơpă, lu sư ưh pă mơn kơ tơdrong yoch boih.

English: But in those sacrifices there is a reminder of sins every year.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư oei soi ling-lang rim sơnăm. Pơm thoi noh lu sư oei đei tơdrong yoch păng oei 'blŏk kơ tơdrong yoch đêl pơm. Ưh kơ gơh klaih ôh thoi noh

English: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and goats could take away sins.
Bahnar: yua kơ lu sư gơnang kơ soi hăm pham rơmo pham bơbe khan klaih kơ tơdrong yoch. Thoi yơ pham rơmo pham bơbe gơh pơklaih tơdrong yoch? Pham noh ưh kơ gơh pơklaih minh tơdrong kiơ.

English: Therefore, when He came into the world, He said: “Sacrifice and offering You did not desire, But a body You have prepared for Me.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Yêsu Krist jur tơ teh đak âu sơ̆, Sư khan kơ 'Bă Sư thoi âu: “Ih ưh kơ gĭt kơ tơmam đe pơyơ̆r soi kơ Ih ôh, na Ih ăn kơ Inh jing kon bơngai.

English: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin You had no pleasure.
Bahnar: Ih ưh kơ wă kơ kon bơngai soi kơ Ih, kon kơ Ih sem dơrong huai đơ̆ng yoch ôh.

English: Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come— In the volume of the book it is written of Me— To do Your will, O God.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei Inh wă khan kơ Ih, ơ Kră Yang, Inh wă jur jang dôm tơdrong thoi Ih wă, thoi đe chih roi lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Ih.”

English: Previously saying, “Sacrifice and offering, burnt offerings, and offerings for sin You did not desire, nor had pleasure in them” (which are offered according to the law)
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ 'Bă Sư thoi noh boih, Sư khan: “Ih ưh kơ wă kơ kon bơngai soi kơ Ih, koh kơ Ih sem dơrong huai đơ̆ng yoch ôh,” yua kơ dôm tơdrong soi noh, đe soi kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong so sơ̆. Thoi noh na dang ei bơ̆n băt nhên boih, Kră Yang athei bơ̆n tŭk lê̆ tơdrong soi kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong so.

English: then He said, “Behold, I have come to do Your will, O God.” He takes away the first that He may establish the second.
Bahnar: Thoi Sư kư̆m đei khan thoi âu: “Dang ei Inh wă khan kơ Ih, Inh wă jur jang dôm tơdrong thoi Ih wă.” Sư khan thoi noh, Sư wă jang kiơ̆ thoi 'Bă Sư tơpă, wă pơgơ̆p bơ̆n kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ tơdrong 'nao.

English: By that will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bơ̆n băt kơ Yêsu Krist jang trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă tơpă, Sư soi akâu Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei minh 'măng sơ̆ tôm boih, na lu bơ̆n dang ei jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt yua kơ Sư.

English: And every priest stands ministering daily and offering repeatedly the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins.
Bahnar: Đĭ kơ lu 'bok soi oei jang hơnơ̆ng rim năr soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei tơdrong soi noh ưh kơ gơh pơklaih tơdrong yoch ôh.

English: But this Man, after He had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down at the right hand of God
Bahnar: Gah Yêsu Krist, Sư soi akâu Sư kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơklaih tơdrong yoch kon bơngai minh 'măng sơ̆ tôm boih. Dang ei Sư tơoei gah 'ma kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: from that time waiting till His enemies are made His footstool.
Bahnar: Sư oei tơ noh tơ̆p 'Bok Kei-Dei blah rôp lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Sư, tơ kơnơl jơ̆ng Sư.

English: For by one offering He has perfected forever those who are being sanctified.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă gơnang kơ Sư soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei akâu Sư minh 'măng noh gô klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch jing 'lơ̆ng tơpăt hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh pă layơ jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư boih.

English: But the Holy Spirit also witnesses to us; for after He had said before
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'noh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng khan kơ bơ̆n. Hơdrol sư khan thoi âu

English: “This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, says the LORD: I will put My laws into their hearts, and in their minds I will write them,”
Bahnar: “Ning-mônh Inh wă pơjing tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'nao kơ lu bơngai Isơrael thoi âu: Inh wă tah tơdrong juăt Inh pơkă tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m lu sư, Inh wă chih tơ'băk tơdrong juăt Inh tơ lăm đon tơchĕng lu sư. Tơdrong noh boih Kră Yang khan.”

English: then He adds, “Their sins and their lawless deeds I will remember no more.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng khan thoi âu dơ̆ng: “Inh gô mơnat kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư đêl pơm, Inh ưh pă tơchĕng boih kơ dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh.”

English: Now where there is remission of these, there is no longer an offering for sin.
Bahnar: Tơdrong yoch, bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih boih, na bơ̆n ưh pă kăl kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam wă soi kơ Sư dơ̆ng boih.

English: Therefore, brethren, having boldness to enter the Holiest by the blood of Jesus
Bahnar: Ơ 'nhŏng oh, bơ̆n gơnang kơ pham Yêsu, bơ̆n huay kơ hli ôh mơ̆t tơ anih giĕng tih, yua kơ Yêsu soi kơ bơ̆n boih.

English: by a new and living way which He consecrated for us, through the veil, that is, His flesh
Bahnar: Bơ̆n rok trong 'nao, trong arih Yêsu pơih ăn, Sư dang hek tŭk che đe pĕng kuă ăn bơ̆n mơ̆t, wă khan akâu Sư kơdih lôch tang, pham lĕch sĕch huŏng, wă kơ bơ̆n gơh mơ̆t.

English: and having a High Priest over the house of God
Bahnar: Sư pơm 'bok soi tih tơgŭm kon pơlei pơla 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience and our bodies washed with pure water.
Bahnar: Thoi noh bĕ bơ̆n năm jê̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơ̆n athei iŏk đon tơpăt, lui kơ Sư sơng iŏk bơ̆n mă tơpă, na jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n huay kơ tơchĕng kơnê̆, yua kơ bơ̆n đei pham Yêsu soi kơ bơ̆n boih. Sư dang tơtreh pham Sư tơ lăm jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n, bơ̆n jing bơngai rơgoh 'lơ̆ng boih; păng pơthim kơ năr bơ̆n iŏk 'batem dang bơ̆n hum đak hlăng 'lơ̆ng tăm.

English: Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering, for He who promised is faithful.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n athei wei mă kơjăp tơdrong mă bơ̆n chang sơmĕng ei, 'nĕ kơ lui pơngiĕl Sư. Yua kơ dôm nơ̆r Sư pơkă ưh kơ lah tŭk minh nơ̆r.

English: And let us consider one another in order to stir up love and good works
Bahnar: Bơ̆n athei băt tơchĕng gah tơdrong pơlung băl, wă kơ bơ̆n đei đon 'mêm mơnat hăm pơm 'lơ̆ng.

English: not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as is the manner of some, but exhorting one another, and so much the more as you see the Day approaching.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ lê̆ tơdrong akŭm, thoi lu đe mơ'nah mă lê̆ dang ei. Yua kơ dang ei wă jê̆ truh khei năr Yêsu Krist wă jur boih, na bơ̆n athei adrin pơlung băl gah tơdrong 'noh rai dêh.

English: For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins
Bahnar: Bơ̆n băt boih tơdrong Yêsu Krist, mă bơ̆n wih lê̆ tơdrong lui pơm yoch dơ̆ng, bơ̆n ưh pă đei tơdrong soi kiơ mă gơh pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch

English: but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and fiery indignation which will devour the adversaries.
Bahnar: pôm chang gô tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang wă phak lăm ŭnh kơdơ̆r tih đĕch, hli dêh. Ŭnh noh wă soh pơmat lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Anyone who has rejected Moses’ law dies without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pơm yoch kơ tơdrong juăt Môis pơkă, đei 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai kư̆m 'bôh sư pơm yoch tơpă, bơngai noh đe athei pơlôch sư, ưh kơ gơh mơnat ăn kơ sư arih ôh.

English: Of how much worse punishment, do you suppose, will he be thought worthy who has trampled the Son of God underfoot, counted the blood of the covenant by which he was sanctified a common thing, and insulted the Spirit of grace?
Bahnar: Tơpă, iĕm tơchĕng lăng tơdrong lu bơngai mă pơjuă kơtĭt Kon pôm 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lăng pham Kon Sư đêl pơm kơ sư rơgoh, mă sư pơm pơhơi thoi ưh kơ yua. Păng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng bơtho tơgŭm bơ̆n tôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng mă sư pơjăm ngôi. Iĕm tơchĕng lăng bơngai noh hăm trŏ kơ phak? Phak tih tơpă ưh kơ băt tih dang yơ.

English: For we know Him who said, “Vengeance is Mine, I will repay,” says the Lord. And again, “The LORD will judge His people.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan sơ̆ boih thoi âu: “Lê̆ kơ Inh pơm tơwih kơ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆.” Sư khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Inh gô sek tơlang lu kon pơlei pơla Inh.” Sư khan thoi noh, bơ̆n băt kơ Sư wă pơm tơpă.

English: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
Bahnar: Na bơ̆n pơm ưh kơ 'blep trŏ kơ tơ'ngla mă arih ling-lang, hơmơt dêh hli kơ Sư phak.

English: But recall the former days in which, after you were illuminated, you endured a great struggle with sufferings
Bahnar: Iĕm athei 'blŏk kơ năr hơdrol, năr mă iĕm pơtơm lui sơ̆. Hlôi iĕm kơtơ̆ng tơdrong Yêsu Krist boih, na iĕm lui kiơ̆ hloi, iĕm đei iŏk tơdrong gleh đe pơm pơmat iĕm, mă-lei iĕm oei adrin lui khŏm khŏm 'mơ̆i.

English: partly while you were made a spectacle both by reproaches and tribulations, and partly while you became companions of those who were so treated
Bahnar: Kơplah noh sơ̆ đe che bơle pơ'brơh pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu iĕm 'bơ̆t anăp đe kon pơlei pơla, na lu iĕm mă hlôi hlăi boih, iĕm băt kơ năm pơlung lu bôl iĕm mă đe oei pơmat.

English: for you had compassion on me in my chains, and joyfully accepted the plundering of your goods, knowing that you have a better and an enduring possession for yourselves in heaven.
Bahnar: Iĕm băt mơnat kơ lu bôl iĕm đe tah lăm hnam phak, iĕm băt kơ năm ngôi hơpong tơ lu sư. Đe tơpleh iŏk mŭk tơmam iĕm, iĕm mơ̆ng đĕch huay kơ sơ'ngon tơdrong kiơ, yua kơ iĕm băt kơ iĕm gô đei mŭk tơmam tơ kơpal plĕnh ti 'lơ̆ng hloh păng ưh kơ băt hiong tăm.

English: Therefore do not cast away your confidence, which has great reward.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm 'nĕ kơ lê̆ tơdrong lui. Yua kơ iĕm lui kơjăp boih, iĕm gô đei tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei asong tơ plĕnh ti.

English: For you have need of endurance, so that after you have done the will of God, you may receive the promise
Bahnar: Iĕm athei adrin ling-lang mă tơpă, na iĕm pơm trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon, gơh iŏk dôm tơdrong Sư pơkă khan wă asong kơ bơ̆n noh.

English: “For yet a little while, And He who is coming will come and will not tarry.
Bahnar: Yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan boih kiơ̆ kơ đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư khan sơ̆ thoi âu: “Ưh pă đunh boih tơ'ngla mă wă jur, Sư gô jur tơpă.

English: Now the just shall live by faith; But if anyone draws back, My soul has no pleasure in him.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt kiơ̆ Inh, lu sư gô đei tơdrong arih, yua kơ lu sư đei đon lui. Mă-lei dah bơngai bu lêl kơdŭn tơ rŏng kuă kơ kiơ̆ Inh khŏm khŏm, bơngai noh Inh ưh kơ lăp đon kơ sư ôh.”

English: But we are not of those who draw back to perdition, but of those who believe to the saving of the soul.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơ̆n ưh kơ sĭ kơ bơngai mă lêl kơdŭn tơ rŏng wă kơ hiong tơdrong arih ôh, bơ̆n bơngai nuih, bơngai lui kơjăp wă dŏng akâu kơdih gơh arih ling-lang.

English: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
Bahnar: Bơngai đon lui, sư băt tơpă kơ sư gô đei. Tơdrong sư ưh kơ gơh 'bôh sư kư̆m băt kơ đei mơ̆n.

English: For by it the elders obtained a good testimony.
Bahnar: Lu đe yă 'bok sơ̆ ki sơ̆ kach, yua kơ lu sư đei đon lui tơpă, na 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ lu sư.

English: By faith we understand that the worlds were framed by the word of God, so that the things which are seen were not made of things which are visible.
Bahnar: Na lu bơ̆n dang ei, yua kơ bơ̆n lui, na bơ̆n băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơjing plĕnh teh hăm 'bơ̆r Sư sơkat. Thoi noh mă dôm tơdrong kiơ kiơ bơ̆n 'bôh dang ei tă lĕch đơ̆ng bơ̆n ưh kơ 'bôh ngăl.

English: By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he obtained witness that he was righteous, God testifying of his gifts; and through it he being dead still speaks.
Bahnar: 'Bok Abel sơ̆ yua kơ sư đei đon lui, na sư soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei trŏ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon. Gah 'nhŏng sư Kain sư soi ưh kơ trŏ ôh, na 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ lăp đon kơ sư. 'Bok Abel sư đei đon lui tơpă, na 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng. Thoi noh na 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ tơdrong sư soi noh. 'Bok Abel lôch boih, mă-lei đe oei ư-ang sư truh dang ei yua kơ sư đei đon lui.

English: By faith Enoch was taken away so that he did not see death, “and was not found, because God had taken him”; for before he was taken he had this testimony, that he pleased God.
Bahnar: 'Bok Ênŏk sơ̆ kư̆m lei-lăi, sư đei đon lui na 'Bok Kei-Dei atŏk sư tơ plĕnh đơ̆ng sư oei arih, na đe chă sư ưh kơ 'bôh yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei iŏk sư boih. Hơdrol kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă iŏk sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei băt kơ sư đei đon lui na 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon wă iŏk sư.

English: But without faith it is impossible to please Him, for he who comes to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of those who diligently seek Him.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ đei đon lui, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ lăp đon ôh. Bơngai bu wă năm tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư athei lui kơ đei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă na 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon păng athei lui kơ Sư wă tơgŭm dôm lu bơngai mă krao chă Sư.

English: By faith Noah, being divinely warned of things not yet seen, moved with godly fear, prepared an ark for the saving of his household, by which he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith.
Bahnar: 'Bok Nôê sơ̆ kư̆m yua kơ sư lui, na lăp sư kơtơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư ning-mônh gô đei tơdrong truh na sư lui hloi. Sư pơm minh pôm duk tih wă dŏng pơklaih hnam dơnŏ sư. Sư chu 'Bok Kei-Dei, thoi noh na sư tơbăt kơ bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đĭ-đăng kon bơngai nai yoch ngăl. Pôm 'bok Nôê đĕch 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ bơngai 'lơ̆ng, yua kơ sư đei đon lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kơjăp.

English: By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to go out to the place which he would receive as an inheritance. And he went out, not knowing where he was going.
Bahnar: Abraham kư̆m yua kơ sư đei đon lui kơjăp, na lăp 'Bok Kei-Dei athei sư năm oei tơ dêh nai, na sư năm hloi tơ dêh mă 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă ăn kơ sư noh. Sư kư̆ kơ năm, mă ưh kơ băt wă năm tơ dêh ayơ.

English: By faith he dwelt in the land of promise as in a foreign country, dwelling in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise
Bahnar: Truh boih tơ dêh mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ sư, mă-lei sư ưh kơ pơ̆n kơ iŏk ôh, yua kơ tam mă lăp kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn, mă-lei sư kư̆ kơ lui kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă. Sư oei tơ noh hlŏng hloi, mă-lei thoi bơngai tơmoi đĕch. Hnam sư pơm păng tua-la-tăng, oei hơdai kon sâu sư Isăk, Jakôp mă 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m pơkă wă ăn kơ lu sư oei tơ noh.

English: for he waited for the city which has foundations, whose builder and maker is God.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ sĭ sư chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư teh đak âu đĕch ôh, sư kư̆m chang gô 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ sư oei tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti. Pơlei noh pơlei dơnơ̆ng ling-lang ưh kơ tôch.

English: By faith Sarah herself also received strength to conceive seed, and she bore a child when she was past the age, because she judged Him faithful who had promised.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư đei đon lui na mă klo kăn bre sư kră pă kĕ, 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bre sư yă Sara gơh pơjing kon. Na sư lui hloi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă ăn kơ bre sư kon kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă.

English: Therefore from one man, and him as good as dead, were born as many as the stars of the sky in multitude—innumerable as the sand which is by the seashore.
Bahnar: Abraham kră pă kĕ dang lĕ kơ lôch boih, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư gơh pơjing lơ kon sâu, dang sơnglŏng tơ plĕnh, dang pơlao chuơh dơsĭ, pă bu kĕ jô̆.

English: These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them afar off were assured of them, embraced them and confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
Bahnar: Đĭ kơ hnam dơnŏ sư oei chang gô truh kơ lôch. Lu sư ưh tam đei tôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, mă-lei dang lu sư 'bôh lê̆ boih, lu sư hiôk tơpă, mă khan sư oei tơ noh dang kơ bơngai tơmoi. Lu sư roi kơ đe kư̆m thoi noh, lu sư oei tơ noh dang kơ bơngai tơmoi.

English: For those who say such things declare plainly that they seek a homeland.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma thoi noh, bơ̆n băt kơ lu sư 'maih chă teh đak hiôk wă oei.

English: And truly if they had called to mind that country from which they had come out, they would have had opportunity to return.
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah lu sư rơnguơ̆ kơ teh đak so sư kơdih, đêl lu sư jăk achăng lê̆ sơ̆, na tơ̆ng lu sư wă brŏk oei dơ̆ng, kư̆m gơh mơ̆n.

English: But now they desire a better, that is, a heavenly country. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, for He has prepared a city for them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh ôh, lu sư wă chă minh pôm teh đak hiôk hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng, teh đak ei tơ plĕnh ti. Thoi noh na lu sư krao kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon kơ lu sư, ăn hloi kơ lu sư minh pôm teh đak tơ plĕnh ti wă pơjing pơlei lu sư.

English: By faith Abraham, when he was tested, offered up Isaac, and he who had received the promises offered up his only begotten son
Bahnar: Abraham đei đon lui tơpă. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơlong lăng sư đĕch, athei sư soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kon pôm sư Isăk, sư chu hloi

English: of whom it was said, “In Isaac your seed shall be called,”
Bahnar: mă khan đêl 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă đơ̆ng kon sư Isăk gô đei pơjing lơ kon sâu.

English: concluding that God was able to raise him up, even from the dead, from which he also received him in a figurative sense.
Bahnar: Abraham sư băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh tơiung arih kon bơngai đơ̆ng lôch, na sư tơchĕng kon sư kư̆m gô iung arih, na sư chu wă soi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Kon sư dang lĕ kơ lôch, dang lĕ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih boih, yua kơ pă 'biơ̆ đĕch wă lôch boih.

English: By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.
Bahnar: Isăk kư̆m lui kơjăp, na sư pơkă kơ bre kon sư Jakôp hăm Êsâu ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơgŭm bre kon sư.

English: By faith Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph, and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff.
Bahnar: Jakôp kư̆m lui kơjăp, na hơdrol kơ sư wă lôch, sư iung rôp 'long jra kŭp kơ̆l khan kơ bre sâu sư kon Yôsep, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô tơgŭm bre sư.

English: By faith Joseph, when he was dying, made mention of the departure of the children of Israel, and gave instructions concerning his bones.
Bahnar: Yôsep kư̆m lui kơjăp, na hơdrol kơ sư wă lôch, sư pơma khan lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơlĕch lu bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ păng pơkă athei chĕp ba kơting sư 'bŭ tơ dêh sư kơdih.

English: By faith Moses, when he was born, was hidden three months by his parents, because they saw he was a beautiful child; and they were not afraid of the king’s command.
Bahnar: Mĕ 'bă Môis kư̆m đei đon lui, na lăp bre sư tơpŭ kơ nge Môis, na bre sư lăng nge 'noh 'bak 'lơ̆ng, na bre sư ôn nge 'noh truh tơ pêng khei, kơlih kơ kơplah noh 'bok pơtao chă pơlôch đĭ lu kon nge drŏ-nglo. Mă-lei mĕ 'bă Môis ưh kơ hli kơ 'bok pơtao ôh. Jơhngơ̆m bre sư oei hiôk đĕch.

English: By faith Moses, when he became of age, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter
Bahnar: Truh tơ Môis tơdăm 'lŏ boih, yua kơ sư đei đon lui, sư kuă kơ oei păng mĕ thăm sư kon pơtao Pharôn.

English: choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God than to enjoy the passing pleasures of sin
Bahnar: Sư 'maih iŏk tơdrong pơmat-tat hơdai hăm lu bôl sư kon 'Bok Kei-Dei hloh kơ sư oei hiôk jơnap tơ lăm hnam 'bok pơtao, mă oei pơm yoch; păng tơdrong hiôk jơnap kon bơngai ưh kơ đunh ôh.

English: esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt; for he looked to the reward.
Bahnar: Sư tơchĕng lê̆ đe pơmat sư yua kơ sư kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Krist, hiôk hloh kơ sư iŏk dôm mŭk tơmam pơtao tơ dêh Êyiptơ yua kơ ning-mônh sư băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gô apah sư lơ hloh.

English: By faith he forsook Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; for he endured as seeing Him who is invisible.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư đei đon lui, na sư jăk achăng lê̆ dêh Êyiptơ. Sư ưh kơ hli kơ 'bok pơtao hil kơ sư ôh, sư kư̆ kơ năm hloi, yua kơ sư dang lĕ 'bôh akâu 'Bok Kei-Dei mă bơ̆n ưh kơ 'bôh.

English: By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, lest he who destroyed the firstborn should touch them.
Bahnar: Sư đei đon lui tơpă, na sư gơh pơjing giĕng mă đe anăn Giĕng Năm Brih kiơ̆ thoi 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă. Sư athei lu bơngai Isơrael pik pham bơbe, pham triu tơ 'măng hnam lu sư wă kơ 'bok mă chă pơlôch kon kơdră lu bơngai Êyiptơ 'bôh, na huay pơlôch hơwơ̆l kon lu sư.

English: By faith they passed through the Red Sea as by dry land, whereas the Egyptians, attempting to do so, were drowned.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael đei đon lui, na kơplah lu sư găn đak dơsĭ 'brê sơ̆, lu sư yak thoi lĕ kơ yak kơpal teh hrĕng kro đĕch. Mă-lei lăp lu bơngai Êyiptơ găn kiơ̆, lu sư glơ̆k lôch đĭ hloi.

English: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down after they were encircled for seven days.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael đei đon lui, na lu sư năm blah Pơlei Jêrikô, dăr hăm akâu sư kơdih đĕch, tơpơh năr dăr, dur Pơlei Jêrikô pơchah phê̆ lêng bêng.

English: By faith the harlot Rahab did not perish with those who did not believe, when she had received the spies with peace.
Bahnar: Yă Rahap sơ̆ sư bơngai đi, đơ̆ng rŏng sư đei đon lui, na sư huay kơ lôch hơdai hăm lu bôl sư bơngai mă ưh kơ lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ sư sơng iŏk lu bơngai Isơrael, lu mă năm lăng tông pơlei sư ki.

English: And what more shall I say? For the time would fail me to tell of Gideon and Barak and Samson and Jephthah, also of David and Samuel and the prophets
Bahnar: Na inh wă pơma kiơ dơ̆ng, inh pơma dôm noh iĕm hlôh boih. Inh roi kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong Gêdêôn, Barak, Samsŏng, Jêpti, Đawit, Samuel păng lu 'bok pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, mă inh ưh kơ wăn.

English: who through faith subdued kingdoms, worked righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions
Bahnar: Lu sư đei đon lui tơpă, na lu sư kĕ blah iŏk lơ teh đak noh nai. Lu sư bơngai pơgơ̆r tơpăt ling-lang, lu sư 'bôh tơpă boih tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă wă ăn kơ lu sư noh. Lăm lu sư kư̆m đei gơh pơŏm 'bơ̆r kiĕk.

English: quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, out of weakness were made strong, became valiant in battle, turned to flight the armies of the aliens.
Bahnar: Mă đe tah sư tơ lăm pla ŭnh tih, ŭnh huay kơ sa sư ôh. Đe wă koh pơlôch sư tơpă boih, mă-lei đei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơdŏng. Hơdrol lu sư tơrăn, đơ̆ng rŏng lu sư jing pran, blah pơpuh tŭk lu linh dêh đe mă ayăt kơ lu sư.

English: Women received their dead raised to life again. Others were tortured, not accepting deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection.
Bahnar: Yua kơ minh tơdrong lui, na lu sư rai đunh rai tih kơjăp. Na đei lu bơngai drŏ-kăn mơ'nah đei lu kon sư đêl lôch boih iung arih dơ̆ng. Lu bơngai lui mơ'nah đe teh pơlôch sư yua kơ sư ưh kơ chu lê̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư tơchĕng lôch bưh, iung arih oei hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei hiôk hloh.

English: Still others had trial of mockings and scourgings, yes, and of chains and imprisonment.
Bahnar: Lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng, đe che bơle kơ sư, teh sư păng sơnguĕt tơlei, chô̆ sư păng tơlei glang mam, tah sư tơ lăm hnam phak, mă-lei sư kư̆m ưh kơ chu lê̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: They were stoned, they were sawn in two, were tempted, were slain with the sword. They wandered about in sheepskins and goatskins, being destitute, afflicted, tormented
Bahnar: Lu mơ'nah đe klơ̆m sư păng tơmo, mơ'nah đe ot kơtĕch akâu sư păng juơ, mơ'nah đe koh pơlôch păng đao. Lu mơ'nah jơ̆l kơ dơnuh hin chă hrŭk hrăi ao pơm păng akar triu, akar bơbe. Lu sư dơnuh tơpă mă-lei đe oei areh kơ lu sư, pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu sư 'mơ̆i.

English: of whom the world was not worthy. They wandered in deserts and mountains, in dens and caves of the earth.
Bahnar: Jô̆ gah tơdrong pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, lu sư 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai ala teh, pă rŏ kơ lu sư oei tơ teh âu, mă-lei lu sư oei oăi tơ tơmăn glă, tơ kông krang hang nak, tơ gơp tơmo.

English: And all these, having obtained a good testimony through faith, did not receive the promise
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư đei đon lui kơjăp, mă-lei kơplah lu sư oei tơ teh sơ̆, lu sư ưh tam mă đei tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă ôh.

English: God having provided something better for us, that they should not be made perfect apart from us.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei wă kơ lu sư gô hơdai bơ̆n dang ei iŏk tơdrong hiôk 'lơ̆ng đêl Sư pơkă, wă khan tơdrong Yêsu Krist jur dŏng pơklaih bơ̆n.

English: Therefore we also, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which so easily ensnares us, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us
Bahnar: Bơ̆n 'bôh lơlap lơlang lu bơngai noh sơ̆, lu sư đei đon lui kơjăp tơpă, na lu bơ̆n athei adrin kiơ̆ thoi lu sư. Bơ̆n adrin thoi lu bơngai kơdâu pơjei băl.
